result.execSummary:
All charges against Breeshawn S Bogan in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Breeshawn S Bogan is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Breeshawn S Bogan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Breeshawn S Bogan in court, in custody.  Attorney Angel L Johnson in court for Breeshawn S Bogan.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Bail/Bond Hear and Scheduling this date.  State advises the Court they will not be able to meet speedy trial demand due to evidence at the Crime Lab not being available.  State moves to dismiss.  Court grants request.  Court orders case dismissed without prejudice.  DEFENDANT TO BE HELD FOR A PERIOD OF 72 HOURS TO ALLOW STATE TIME TO REISSUE.

Defendant Breeshawn S Bogan in court, in custody.  Attorney Angel L Johnson in court for Breeshawn S Bogan.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Final Pretrial this date.  State requests adjournment of trial as they do not have crime lab results.  Defense requests to be heard on bail.  Court vacates trial and schedules bail bond hearing and scheduling conference.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion in Limine received and filed.  bm
Section 971.23(9) Notice of Intent to use DNA Evidence at Trial received and filed.  bm
State's Witness List received and filed.  bm

Defendant Breeshawn S Bogan not in court, in custody.  Attorney Angel L Johnson in court for Breeshawn S Bogan.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Final Pretrial this date.  Parties make joint request for adjourned Final Pretrial.  Court grants request.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Written Speedy trial demand received and filed.  Case previously calendared for speedy trial.  Speedy Trial expires October 11, 2022.  bm

Defendant Breeshawn S Bogan in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Breeshawn S Bogan in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Status conference held.  Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date.  Parties advised any motion are to be filed by September 1, 2022.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Breeshawn S Bogan in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Breeshawn S Bogan in custody.  Student Intern Jessica Birminham under the supervision of Kathryn Ginsberg for Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  State turned over Discovery.  Defense requested more time to review Discovery.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Breeshawn S Bogan in court, defendant in custody, with attorney Angel L Johnson appear in person. Jennifer Jean Tate appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: City Of Milwaukee Detective J. Emanuel.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Breeshawn S Bogan in court with Attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Breeshawn S Bogan in custody.  Jennifer Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Johnson needs more time to meet with her client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defendant Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed. nk
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Breeshawn S Bogan in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Breeshawn S Bogan in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Breeshawn S Bogan appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
